thread.title: Murder investigation as woman killed by horse sanctuary
thread.title_full: Murder investigation as woman killed by horse sanctuary - Telegraph

author: Nicola Harley
title: Murder investigation as woman killed by horse sanctuary
text: Detectives have launched a murder inquiry after a woman was stabbed to death close to an Essex horse sanctuary. The woman, 21, was stabbed several times on on Friday evening. The first police officers to arrive at the scene tried to save her life by giving CPR. The girl, possibly a stable girl, was stabbed at the Essex Horse and Pony Protection Society in Pitsea Hall Lane They had been called after reports of a fight. She was flown to hospital but died overnight. Walker rescued after 300ft cliff fall The fight happened close to a horse sanctuary by in Pitsea. A knife was found nearby and cordons are in place around the area while forensic teams examine the location. Two men have been arrested in relation to the incident A 22-year-old Basildon man arrested at the scene is being questioned on suspicion of murder, while a second Basildon man, 20, is being questioned in connection with the death after also being arrested on Friday evening. Detective Chief Inspector Marina Ericson, from the Kent and Essex Serious Crime Directorate, is leading the investigation. She said: "This is a tragic incident where a young woman has lost her life in horrific circumstances. "We have arrested two men and our enquiries are continuing." Follow @telegraphnews
